intro: Rhexia heteranthera, commonly known as the showy rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats, often in partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Rhexia heteranthera blooms in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
